docs.lead_paragraph: DETROIT. As total employment pushed to new heights and the jobless rate edged downward, there remained an ugly paradox in America -- a sizable body of hard-core unemployed persons.

headline.main: Help Wanted: The Hard-Core Unemployed; In his State of the Union Message the President called for an attack on the problem of 500,000 Americans who seem permanently jobless in these times of high employment. Here is a report on one experiment in coping with this "ugly paradox."

docs.abstract: G Samuels article on Ford Motor Co program to recruit and train hard-core jobless, chiefly Negroes from Detroit inner city; hiring procedure and subsequent employment gains and failures discussed; inability of some to adjust to factory life cited; illus
docs.snippet: DETROIT. As total employment pushed to new heights and the jobless rate edged downward, there remained an ugly paradox in America -- a sizable body of hard-core unemployed persons.

keywords.value: HARD-CORE JOBLESS AND SLUM AREAS, PROGRAMS FOR

docs.lead_paragraph: Shortly after noon yesterday Harry W. Raybin picked up the phone on his cluttered desk in the City's Department of Health.

headline.main: The Phones Never Stop Ringing at Poison Control Bureau; The Phones Never Stop Ringing At City Poison Control Bureau

docs.abstract: NYC Poison Control Center work in diagnosing and advising on treatment of poisoning described; illus; common poisoning dangers to children noted
